content: Please provide more specific information or a query so that I can assist you further using the provided document about "Game of Thrones."

"Game of Thrones" is an American fantasy drama television series created by David Benioff and D. B. Weiss, originally based on the series of high fantasy novels "A Song of Ice and Fire" by author George R. R. Martin. The show premiered on HBO in the United States on April 17, 2011, and concluded on May 19, 2019, after eight seasons with 73 episodes. The series is set on the fictional continents of Westeros and Essos and follows multiple story arcs involving political conflicts, exiled rulers, and the defense of the realm against various threats. "Game of Thrones" has been highly acclaimed by critics for its acting, complex characters, storylines, scope, and production values, although it generated controversy for its frequent use of nudity and violence. The series has garnered numerous awards, including multiple Emmy Awards, and has a large and dedicated international fan base.
